speaker: waiter
content: All right, I'll go put in your orders, And I'll be right back with your drinks and your plates for the salad bar.
mark: alright: [俚]=all right 好的
I'll go put in your orders 我去给你点餐 go和put in构成一种自然的口语表达结构，go强调动作的趋向，去（做某事）的感觉。put in 提交；提出；放入
I'll be right back 我马上回来：表示暂时离开，很快就会回来。
plate n. 盘，碟；一盘（食物）；

speaker: Bree
content: Andrew, Danielle, napkins?
mark: napkin 餐巾纸

speaker: Andrew
content: They have video games. Could we go play until our food gets here?

speaker: Bree
content: Andrew, this is family time.

speaker: Rex
content: Go ahead and play.
mark: go ahead 前进，继续：继续进行；继续前进

speaker: Bree
content: I know that you think I'm angry about coming here, but I'm not.
mark: be angry about doing sth对做某事感到生气 == be mad at doing sth
a change of pace 改变步调：改变日常生活或工作，尝试新事物避免单调乏味
Saltimbocca 意式煎小牛肉火腿卷

speaker: Bree
content: You and the kids wanted a change of pace, something fun, I get it.

speaker: Bree
content: Probably we'll want something healthier tomorrow night, though. I'm thinking about chicken saltimbocca.

speaker: Rex
content: I want a divorce. I just can't live in this detergent commercial anymore.
mark: detergent 洗涤剂，去污剂
commercial 商业的，商务的；
detergent commercial 清洁剂广告，这是一种隐喻

speaker: waiter
content: The salad bar's right over there. Help yourself.
mark: Help yourself 请自便

speaker: Bree
content: Um, I think I'll go get your salad for you.

speaker: Huber
content: Bree Van De Kamp.

speaker: Bree
content: Oh. Hello, Mrs. Huber.

speaker: Huber
content: We didn't get a chance to talk at Mary Alice's wake. How are you doing?
mark: get a chance to do sth 得到一个做某事的机会

speaker: Alice
content: Bree longed to share the truth about her husband's painful betrayal, but sadly for Bree, admitting defeat was not an option.
mark: long to 渴望
betrayal n.背叛，出卖
admit （勉强）承认；招认，招供；准许进入（某处）；接纳，接收
defeat v./n.失败，战败；战胜，击败

speaker: Bree
content: Great. Everything is just great.

speaker: Bree
content: Ok, well, I got you the honey mustard dressing. The ranch looked just a little bit suspect.
mark: honey mustard dressing 蜂蜜芥末酱 mustard n.芥末酱；芥末黄，深黄色 dressing n.（拌制色拉用的）调料；馅，填料 Tomato dressing番茄调味酱
ranch 大农场，大牧场 ranch dressing 牧场沙拉酱
a little bit 稍微；一点点；少量 < a little
suspect adj.不可靠的，不可信的 v.猜想，认为 n. 嫌疑犯，可疑分子
The ranch looked just a little bit suspect. 这个田园酱看起来有点不新鲜了

speaker: Rex
content: Are we going to talk about what I said?

speaker: Bree
content: If you think I'm going to discuss the dissolution of my marriage in a place where the restrooms are labeled "chicks" and "dudes", you're out of your mind.
mark: dissolution 分解，溶解；（议会等的）解散；
in a place where ... 定语从句，对a place 进行限定和描述，说明是怎样的地方
chicks 雏鸟，小鸡；少女，小妞儿 dudes 家伙，小子
you're out of your mind 你疯了

speaker: Rex
content: What's in this?

speaker: Bree
content: What do you mean, What's in this? It's salad.

speaker: Rex
content: With onion. You put onion in my salad.

speaker: Bree
content: No, I didn't. Oh wait…
